entities.description: The unlawful killing of a human being by another.
The killing of another person through gross negligence.
The killing of a person under circumstances that allow the act to be regarded in law as without criminal guilt.
The unlawful seizure and carrying away of a person by force.
Sexual activity carried out against a person's will.
Sexual activity involving anal or oral copulation.
Unlawful penetration of a person with a foreign object without the victim's consent.
Touching private parts of another person for sexual gratification.
Taking or attempting to take something by force or threat of force.
An attack for the purpose of inflicting severe or aggravated bodily injury.
An attack without a weapon resulting in no or minor injury.
Unlawfully placing another person in fear of bodily harm without physical attack.
The criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property.
Obtaining money or other value by threats or coercion.
Unlawful entry into a structure to commit a theft or felony.
Stealing from another person's pockets or bags without their notice.
Forcibly stealing a purse or handbag from an individual.
The act of stealing goods from a retail establishment.
The act of stealing property from a building.

entities.entity: Theft From Coin-Operated Machine or Device
entities.description: Theft from a machine or device designed to receive money.
Stealing items from within a motor vehicle.
Stealing parts or accessories from a motor vehicle.
Theft that does not fit into any of the other defined categories of larceny.
The theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle.
Making, altering, or possessing counterfeit items or falsifying documents.
Deceiving someone to acquire money or something of value.
Deceptive acts involving credit cards or ATMs to gain unauthorized access to funds.
Assuming another person’s identity to deceive or gain advantage.
Illegally obtaining welfare benefits.

relationships.description: Classification of the unlawful killing of a human being by another as a crime.
Classification of the killing of another person through gross negligence as a crime.
Classification of the killing of a person under certain circumstances as a form of homicide.
Classification of the unlawful seizure and carrying away of a person by force as a crime.
Classification of non-consensual sexual activity as a sexual crime.
Classification of unlawful penetration with a foreign object as a sexual crime.
Classification of unlawfully placing another person in fear of bodily harm without physical attack as a crime.
Classification of the deliberate setting of fire to property as a crime.
Classification of obtaining money or value by threats or coercion as a crime.
Classification of unlawful entry into a structure to commit a theft or felony as a property crime.
Classification of stealing goods from a retail establishment as theft.
Classification of the theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle as a form of theft.
Classification of making, altering, or possessing counterfeit items or falsifying documents as fraud.
Classification of assuming another person’s identity to deceive or gain advantage as fraud.
Classification of illegally obtaining welfare benefits as fraud.
